meanings.definition: Record (additional sounds) on an existing recording.
meanings.sent1: She overdubbed her voice onto the song to make it sound better.
meanings.sent2: The musician overdubbed the guitar solo onto the track.
meanings.sent3: The cat overdubbed its meows onto the video of birds chirping.
meanings.sent4: His laughter overdubbed the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The rain overdubbed the silence, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: They overdubbed the sound effects to enhance the movie scene.
meanings.sent2: The sound engineer overdubbed the background vocals for the chorus.
meanings.sent3: The clown overdubbed silly noises onto the serious speech.
meanings.sent4: Her footsteps overdubbed the quiet hallway, breaking the silence.
meanings.sent5: The wind overdubbed the trees, adding a mysterious whisper.
